around top needle once more then bring yarn between and thread through a blunt yarn needle hold needles parallel needles with another needle knit sts across top needle with wss facing in and both needles pointing to the right then knit sts across bottom needle if using circulars you can perform step 2 on the first front st then step 4 on the first pull bottom needle through the loops so the loops are now back st then continue from step 1 always pulling yarn tightly on the cable and use it to knit the loops on top needle so the grafted row gauge matches the knitted fabric jeny s stretchy slipknot cast-on step 1 pull yarn needle k-wise through front st and drop an extremely stretchy cast-on method that does not require st from knitting needle a long tail great for starting top-down socks step 2 pull yarn needle p-wise through next front st directions place a slip knot on your needle make another leaving st on knitting needle slip knot with the working yarn but instead of placing it on step 3 pull yarn needle p-wise through first back st the needle pull the working yarn through the slip knot and and drop st from knitting needle place that loop on the needle make sure this loop sits very step 4 pull yarn needle k-wise through next back st close to the previous st pull the working yarn until the new leaving st on knitting needle st is tight repeat for all cast-on sts repeat steps 1-4 until all sts have been grafted together finishing by working step 1 through the last remaining stretchy bind off front st then step 3 through the last remaining back st good for binding off
